Quick Facts

EXIT   X

DUTIES OF PCBUs

Page

Table of Contents

 

 

Do you remember the scenario?

 

 

What official steps is ABC Industry required to take?

Scenario

 

ABC Industry is a global manufacturer of construction equipment that has recently entered the Australian market. A newly hired marketing team is getting ready to start promoting the business and creating awareness that it is now operating locally.

 

Keen to make a good impression, designer David decides to use the guillotine to cut some dummy brochures to size. He has never used this particular type of machine before, but is sure he can work it out. He sees no point in hassling his manager Andrew for instructions.

 

A few minutes later, David falls to the floor, hitting his head on a nearby table. It appears that David had not properly locked out the guillotine and has severed his fingertips.

None, David was negligent in asking Andrew for instructions

Notify the incident and preserve the incident site

ABC Industry and David have a duty to report the incident and preserve the site

 
 
 

That is incorrect

 

As the PCBU, ABC Industry needs to report the incident to the regulator, it doesn’t matter who is perceived to be at fault. As the person with management or control of the workplace, ABC Industry also has a duty to make sure the site is preserved.

That is correct!

 

As the PCBU, ABC Industry needs to report the incident to the regulator. ABC Industry also has a duty to make sure the site is preserved.

That is incorrect

 

As the PCBU, ABC Industry needs to report the incident to the regulator. ABC Industry also has a duty to make sure the site is preserved.
